title: Coronado National Memorial: Park Statistics
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Park Statistics              Park Statistics       The site was first designated "Coronado International Memorial" in 1941 in the hope that a comparable adjoining area would be established in Mexico. Despite interest by the government of Mexico, the Mexican memorial was never created; therefore, Coronado National Memorial was established by Harry S. Truman in 1952. Acreage Gross Area Acres - 4,750  Visitation Total Recreation Visits for FY 2009 - 106,409 Total Recreation Visits for FY 2010 - 136,284 Total Recreation Visits for FY 2011 - 153,042 Total Recreation Visits for FY 2012 - 97,579 Total Recreation Visits for FY 2013 - 92,963 Total Recreation Visits for FY 2014 - 118,838  Species Checklist Birds - 167 Mammals - 59 Reptiles and Amphibians - 29 Plants  - 645 - click the link for a current list of plant species found in the park.
